div.p: EDUCATION is one of the 16 major, DIV1 elements defined as integral to mapping a woman's life in the BIOGRAPHY section of entries. EDUCATION contains all information about a person's educational experience. Particular emphasis is placed on where and when she went to school (content tagging here will provide important links between different women writers who had the same teacher or went to the same school), gender issues (the conditions affecting women's access to education), and subjects studied (making connections between a subject studied by the writer and topics of her writing). In most instances this element will directly follow the FAMILY element capturing information about the subjectâ€™s parents, and education from primary to post-secondary will be included in the same element. But it can be used repeatedly in one entry to reflect chronology or to apply different attribute values - when, for example, the subject attended university later in life. This tag has content sub-elements: AWARD, COMPANION, CONTESTEDBEHAVIOUR, DEGREE, INSTRUCTOR, SCHOOL, SUBJECT, TEXT. It has an optional attribute, MODE, used to register whether the education took place at home, in an institution or self-driven. Though optional, this attribute should be used whenever you know what value to fill in.

Lady Margaret Hall 1886GB began studies at Lady Margaret Hall, Oxford University.

Her experience at Oxford was shaped by the strict segregation of the sexes that she experienced there. One of her history instructors had a separate table on the platform for his women students which meant that they were sitting with their backs to him

.

Early Education

While growing up in Manchester, IB attended both Miss Hannah Spray's Ladies' Day School at Dale Street and Green Street School.

div.p: Remember to use the MODE attribute, inserting multiple education elements if necessary in order to use the appropriate attribute. Some CHRONSTRUCTs welcome (e.g. entering and graduating from university) but be selective with them.
Question: What if I have a writer who was educated in her home by her brother but then went on to study at a boarding school?
Problem: The Mode attribute to capture either domestic and institutional education is attached to the Div1 element and only one can be selected.
Answer:Include two successive DIV1 elements -- one for her domestic education and another for her education at boarding school.
Question: How do you tag a school that she taught at?
Answer: Put it under Occupation. This why it needs an ORGNAME tag as well as a SCHOOL tag.
